column4: when i do 'make xconfig' in a kernel directory i get "/usr/include/wchar.h:345: error: ‘__extern_inline’ does not name a type".  anybody know what that means
its to do with pointers and types
know how to fix it, by chance?
not without seeing the source code
'make xconfig' has worked on my system before, so I don't know why it stopped now
well the code is probably broken due to an upgrade or something, getting me line 345 of your wchar.h would be a start :)
__extern_inline size_t
ok ill check it out
upgraded stuff recently? :)
what stuff precisely
just in general? yes
anything that would touch /usr/include, such as kernel headers, -dev packages, any development headers, just headers really :P
yea, i think a few days ago there was an update for the generic kernel headers
sounds like your problem mate
yea, I'm not sure if (or why) kernel headers touch stdlib.h
i really have no clue though
im working on it ;)
